items.description: API Management solutions offer a comprehensive approach to handling the entire API lifecycle. They enable developers to create, publish, secure, and monitor APIs, ensuring efficient and reliable communication between systems. With features such as authentication, rate limiting, and analytics, these tools provide centralized control and enhanced security, making it easier to manage and scale APIs across different platforms and environments.
Provides comprehensive lifecycle management, enabling rapid digital transformation and robust compliance across multi-cloud environments.
items.title: Akana API Management Platform

items.description: Leverages AWS scalability and security to efficiently create, monitor, and manage APIs.
items.title: Amazon API Management

items.description: Combines API design, integration, and management into one unified platform, streamlining connectivity and development.
items.title: Anypoint Platform

items.description: Offers an open, agile approach to API management with robust integration and flexible deployment options.
items.title: Amplify API Management Platform

items.description: Delivers powerful analytics, security, and scalability for enterprise-grade API management from Google.
items.title: Apigee

items.description: A hybrid, multicloud solution that simplifies API lifecycle management with comprehensive security and analytics.
items.title: Azure API Management

items.description: A cloud-native platform enabling seamless API deployment and centralized management with strong integration capabilities.
items.title: Boomi Cloud API Management

items.description: Transforms APIs into strategic business tools through end-to-end lifecycle management and enhanced operational insights.
items.title: DigitMarket API Manager

items.description: A lightweight, open-source platform offering flexible API governance, robust security, and straightforward configuration.
items.title: Gravitee.io API Management (⭐379)

items.description: Provides a scalable, secure, and intuitive environment for creating, managing, and monetizing APIs across clouds.
items.title: IBM API Connect

items.description: Offers a comprehensive suite for API lifecycle management that seamlessly integrates on-premises and cloud systems.
items.title: IBM webMethods API Management

items.description: A cloud-native, enterprise-grade solution that enhances API connectivity, microservices orchestration, and security via a rich plugin architecture.
items.title: Kong Enterprise

items.description: Ensures secure and efficient API development with continuous lifecycle management and advanced integration features.
items.title: Layer7 API Management

items.description: Simplifies API monetization and governance with a cloud-native approach and powerful scaling capabilities.
items.title: Red Hat 3scale API Management

items.description: Provides a full-lifecycle API solution with advanced security, performance monitoring, and streamlined integration.
items.title: Sensedia API Management

items.description: Provides an API Management as Code platform to DevOps and Platform Engineering Teams who favor less ClickOps and more GitOps-driven API lifecycle workflows.
items.title: Traefik API Management

items.description: Delivers high-performance, open-source API management focused on flexibility, robust security, and scalability.
items.title: Tyk API Management

items.description: A fully open-source API platform offering robust governance, flexible deployment, and community-driven innovation.
items.title: WSO2 API Manager (⭐965)

items.description: A developer-centric, lightweight platform featuring GitOps integration, rapid edge deployment, extensive OpenAPI support, and seamless monetization.
items.title: Zuplo API Management
API Management

items.description: API design, documentation, and life-cycle automation tools streamline the process of creating, maintaining, and evolving APIs. These tools offer efficient means to design consistent and scalable APIs, generate comprehensive documentation, and automate various stages of the API life-cycle, enhancing developer experience and promoting API adoption.
A web-based, open-source API design tool that leverages the OpenAPI specification.
items.title: Apicurio Studio (⭐1k)

items.description: Validate API description docs against backend implementation using this language-agnostic CLI tool.
items.title: Dredd (⭐4.2k)

items.description: Create and validate OpenAPI specs with ease using this intuitive graphical user interface.
items.title: OpenAPI-GUI (⭐1.4k)

items.description: Compare OpenAPI specs with version control and visualize the differences in HTML or Markdown format.
items.title: OpenAPI Diff (⭐1k)

items.description: Automate the creation of API client libraries, server stubs, documentation and config files with this powerful OpenAPI Spec tool.
items.title: OpenAPI Generator (⭐25k)

items.description: Ensure that your OpenAPI specs meet your organization's standards with this flexible and customizable style validator.
items.title: OpenAPI Style Validator (⭐232)

items.description: Detect and fix errors in your JSON/YAML files using this linter tool that supports OpenAPI 3.0 & 2.0 and AsyncAPI.
items.title: Spectral (⭐3k)

items.description: Create, describe, and document your API with ease using this open source editor built specifically for OpenAPI-based APIs.
items.title: Swagger Editor (⭐9.4k)

items.description: Ensure the quality of your OpenAPI specs with this linter tool that provides extensive analysis and feedback.
items.title: Zally (⭐947)
API Design

items.description: Explore a collection of tools and platforms designed to create, maintain, and present clear, concise, and user-friendly documentation for APIs. These resources facilitate seamless collaboration between developers and enable effective communication of API functionalities and specifications.
Generates elegant, interactive API documentation from OpenAPI/Swagger specs with easy customization and automated updates.
items.title: DapperDox (⭐417)

items.description: Creates intuitive, interactive user interfaces from OpenAPI specs, simplifying API exploration and testing.
items.title: OpenAPI Explorer (⭐343)

items.description: Produces highly customizable, interactive API documentation with responsive design and rich configuration options.
items.title: RapiDoc (⭐1.8k)

items.description: Delivers clean, modern documentation with advanced theming, multi-language support, and seamless integration.
items.title: Redoc (⭐25k)

items.description: Converts markdown into stylish, static API documentation with intuitive navigation and clear code examples.
items.title: Slate (⭐36k)

items.description: Provides modular, attractive UI components for building comprehensive API reference and tutorial documentation.
items.title: Stoplight Elements (⭐2.3k)

items.description: An integrated API design and documentation hub that enhances team collaboration, version control, and automated testing.
items.title: SwaggerHub

items.description: Offers an interactive, in-browser tool for visualizing and testing APIs directly from OpenAPI specifications.
items.title: Swagger UI (⭐28k)

items.description: Generates static, customizable documentation for GraphQL schemas, making complex API structures easy to understand.
items.title: SpectaQL (⭐1.2k)

items.description: A customizable framework built on OpenAPI, focused on delivering exceptional developer experiences through quality documentation.
items.title: Zudoku (⭐456)
API Documentation

items.description: API Gateways act as intermediaries between client applications and backend services, enabling key features such as request routing, authentication, rate limiting, and caching. They simplify the process of managing, securing, and monitoring APIs by providing a unified entry point for various services.
A Golang-based gateway that offers dynamic routing, multi-tenancy, and robust API access control for modern architectures.
items.title: Apinto (⭐1.6k)

items.description: A Kubernetes-native API gateway designed for high-scale environments with flexible routing and advanced security features.
items.title: Ambassador Edge Stack

items.description: A high-performance, dynamic gateway featuring real-time traffic management and powerful plugin integrations.
items.title: Apache APISIX (⭐16k)

items.description: A Java-native gateway excelling in protocol conversion, service proxying, and comprehensive API governance.
items.title: Apache ShenYu (⭐8.7k)

items.description: CNCF Envoy-based gateway with Gateway API, mTLS, JWT, and other built-ins.
items.title: Envoy Gateway (⭐2.5k)

items.description: An Envoy Proxy–based gateway offering advanced traffic control, enhanced security, and observability for microservices ecosystems.
items.title: Gloo Edge (⭐150)

items.description: A scalable, cloud-native gateway that simplifies API management through extensive plugin support and seamless microservices integration.
items.title: Kong API Gateway (⭐42k)

items.description: An ultra-high performance gateway with efficient middleware configuration, robust security, and seamless scaling.
items.title: KrakenD API Gateway (⭐2.5k)

items.description: A .NET-based gateway offering intuitive routing and easy integration for lightweight API management.
items.title: Ocelot (⭐8.6k)

items.description: Leverages the Spring ecosystem to deliver robust routing, filtering, and security for microservices.
items.title: Spring Cloud Gateway (⭐4.8k)

items.description: Combines Traefik Proxy, a fully declarative application proxy with enterprise-grade access control, distributed security, and premium integrations.
items.title: Traefik API Gateway (⭐61k)

items.description: An enterprise-grade, open-source gateway supporting REST, GraphQL, TCP, and gRPC with advanced rate limiting and analytics.
items.title: Tyk API Gateway (⭐10k)
API Gateway

items.description: The API testing tools section provides a list of software tools and frameworks that developers can use to test REST APIs and message brokers. This section includes GUI clients for testing REST APIs and message brokers, mocking tools for simulating API responses, as well as various testing tools and frameworks to automate testing processes.

children.description: A robust open-source API client for testing and debugging RESTful services with an intuitive interface.
children.title: Advanced REST Client (⭐1.4k)

children.description: A fast, offline API client designed for git-friendly workflows and seamless testing.
children.title: Bruno (⭐40k)

children.description: A versatile command-line tool for data transfer across multiple protocols, essential for quick API testing.
children.title: curl (⭐40k)

children.description: A modern, user-friendly frontend to curl that combines simplicity with powerful performance.
children.title: curlie (⭐3.5k)

children.description: An interactive web-based tool for gRPC APIs, providing a browser-based interface for testing and exploring gRPC services with dynamic form generation.
children.title: gRPC UI (⭐5.8k)

children.description: A command-line tool for interacting with gRPC servers, enabling inspection and invocation of RPC methods with support for server reflection and protocol buffer files.
children.title: grpcurl (⭐12k)

children.description: An intuitive CLI HTTP client that simplifies crafting API requests and inspecting responses.
children.title: HTTPie (⭐37k)

children.description: Free and lightweight desktop tool for HTTP testing and debugging.
children.title: HttpMaster

children.description: A lightweight, web-based API development tool offering real-time testing with an intuitive interface.
children.title: Hoppscotch (⭐77k)

children.description: A cross-platform client that streamlines API debugging and testing for both REST and GraphQL services.
children.title: Insomnia (⭐37k)

children.description: A modern, terminal-based API client designed for efficient and seamless API interactions.
children.title: posting (⭐11k)

children.description: The industry-standard tool for API development and testing, featuring automation, mock servers, and collaborative documentation.
children.title: Postman

children.description: Lightweight Git-Friendly API Client Built for Modern Developers.
children.title: Requestly (⭐6.2k)

children.description: A Lua-based HTTP client framework providing an interactive shell for streamlined REST service testing.
children.title: resty (⭐2.6k)

children.description: A comprehensive open-source solution for testing both SOAP and REST web services with extensive automation features.
children.title: SoapUI (⭐1.6k)

children.description: A cross-platform desktop gRPC client with automatic proto parsing, TLS support, and intuitive UI for testing unary, streaming, and bidirectional gRPC requests.
children.title: Wombat (⭐1.4k)

children.description: A fast, friendly CLI HTTP client that reimplements HTTPie's design with improved performance, HTTP/2 support, and built-in curl translation.
children.title: xh (⭐7.5k)

children.description: A self-hosted, collaborative API development environment designed for team sharing with multi-user support, persistent storage, and support for REST, WebSockets, and Markdown documentation.
children.title: Yaade (⭐1.9k)

children.description: A fast, privacy-first desktop API client for REST, GraphQL, WebSocket, Server-Sent Events, and gRPC with offline-first design, built with Tauri and React.
children.title: Yaak (⭐17k)

children.description: An open-source automation framework that simplifies continuous testing with intuitive configuration and integration support.

items.description: Business Rules Engines and Business Rules Management Systems (BRMS) are software systems that allow organizations to define, manage, and execute business rules. These rules are used to automate decision-making processes, enforce business policies, and ensure regulatory compliance. A BRMS provides a way for organizations to centrally manage their business rules and make changes to them quickly and easily, without requiring changes to the underlying code. It is a valuable tool for businesses that need to be agile and respond quickly to changing market conditions.
Open-source engine that supports advanced Decision Model and Notation (DMN) with Eclipse IDE integration for efficient rule development.
items.title: Drools (⭐6.2k)

items.description: Lightweight Java-based rules engine designed for straightforward rule processing and rapid decision automation.
items.title: Easy Rules (⭐5.2k)

items.description: Enterprise-grade decision engine that empowers both business and technical users with an intuitive interface for fast rule creation and management.
items.title: FICO Blaze Advisor

items.description: Scalable decision management system that streamlines rule authoring, testing, and updates while ensuring compliance and agility.
items.title: IBM ODM

items.description: Specialized .NET open-source rule engine offering efficient rule processing tailored for Microsoft environments.
items.title: NxBRE (⭐133)

items.description: Flexible open-source decision management system that simplifies defining and executing business rules and decision tables.
items.title: OpenL Tablets (⭐189)

items.description: Model-driven BRMS enabling rapid, no-code rule creation that delivers high-performance automated decisions with guaranteed integrity.
items.title: Progress Corticon

items.description: Enterprise-class decision platform built on Drools, offering advanced DMN support, intuitive UIs, and high availability for large-scale automation.
items.title: Red Hat Decision Manager

items.description: A cross-platform, open-source Business Rules Engine written in Rust that executes JSON Decision Models through interconnected graphs of decision tables, functions, and expressions.
items.title: ZEN Engine (⭐1.5k)
Business Rules Engine

items.description: Change Data Capture (CDC) solutions enable real-time identification and capture of changes made to data in databases, data warehouses, and other data sources. These tools continuously monitor data changes and propagate them to downstream systems, enabling real-time data synchronization, event-driven architectures, and maintaining data consistency across distributed systems. CDC is essential for modern data architectures, microservices, and real-time analytics.
Open-source distributed platform for change data capture that turns your existing databases into event streams for real-time data integration.
items.title: Debezium (⭐12k)

items.description: Enterprise CDC solution that captures and delivers data changes with minimal impact on source systems and low latency.
items.title: IBM InfoSphere CDC

items.description: An open-source CDC tool for MySQL that reads database binlogs and streams row-level changes as JSON to systems like Kafka, Kinesis, or other destinations.
items.title: Maxwell's daemon (⭐4.2k)

items.description: Enterprise-grade real-time data integration and replication solution that provides comprehensive CDC capabilities for heterogeneous databases and cloud platforms.
items.title: Oracle GoldenGate

items.description: Universal data replication software that provides real-time CDC capabilities for modern data architecture and analytics.
items.title: Qlik Replicate
Change Data Capture

items.description: ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) are processes used to integrate and consolidate data from multiple sources. This section covers a range of open source and commercial tools for performing these tasks, including data ingestion, transformation, and loading into data warehouses or other data storage systems.
One-stop, full-scenario integration framework for massive data that supports data ingestion, synchronization, and subscription with real-time ETL capabilities.
items.title: Apache InLong (⭐1.4k)

items.description: Automated data integration tool with a visual interface that seamlessly extracts, transforms, and delivers data across systems.
items.title: Apache NiFi (⭐5.9k)

items.description: Flexible, open-source data integration platform that builds ELT pipelines to move data from diverse sources to modern destinations.
items.title: Airbyte (⭐20k)

items.description: Enterprise ETL suite offering robust data transformation and workflow orchestration for scalable integration.
items.title: CloverDX

items.description: Versatile, scalable platform that provides both real-time and batch data integration for ETL and ELT pipelines.
items.title: Estuary Flow (⭐876)

items.description: Managed ELT that syncs 700 + sources to data warehouses.
items.title: Fivetran

items.description: No-code, fully automated data pipeline platform that supports extensive integrations, simplifying complex data workflows.
items.title: Hevo

items.description: Robust platform that cleanses, transforms, and delivers reliable data, empowering businesses with trusted insights.
items.title: IBM DataStage

items.description: Enterprise-class solution that streamlines big data and cloud analytics through comprehensive data integration management.
items.title: Informatica PowerCenter

items.description: Proven data integration solution for building scalable ETL processes within enterprise environments using SQL Server.
items.title: Microsoft SSIS

items.description: Comprehensive platform that addresses batch loads, real-time processes, and SOA-enabled services for end-to-end data management.
items.title: Oracle Data Integrator

items.description: Intuitive, visual ETL tool that simplifies data ingestion, blending, and cleansing across multiple sources without heavy coding.
items.title: Pentaho Data Integration (⭐8.3k)

items.description: Robust solution that transforms, integrates, and secures data to enhance quality and reliability across the enterprise.
items.title: SAS Data Management

items.description: Developer-friendly SaaS ETL service that effortlessly extracts data from numerous sources into data warehouses for streamlined analytics.
items.title: Stitch

items.description: Versatile platform that unifies disparate data sources into actionable insights to empower informed business decisions.
items.title: Talend Data Integration
Data Integration

items.description: Data Mapping tools are used to define and transform data between different systems, applications, and formats. These tools allow for the mapping of data from source to target, allowing for data transformation and integration. This section covers different data mapping solutions that can be used to facilitate data mapping and transformation processes for different use cases.
Graphical data mapping solution that enables any-to-any conversion, reducing complexity and accelerating integration projects.
items.title: Altova MapForce

items.description: Interactive web-based tool that simplifies mapping across Java, XML, CSV, and JSON data sources with an intuitive interface.
items.title: AtlasMap (⭐209)

items.description: Java-based JSON transformation library that uses a specification-driven approach for effortless JSON-to-JSON conversions.
items.title: JOLT (⭐1.6k)

items.description: Powerful JSON query and transformation language inspired by jq and XPath, designed for rapid and flexible data manipulation.
items.title: JSLT (⭐689)

items.description: Lightweight query and transformation language for JSON data.
items.title: JSONata (⭐2.5k)
Data Mapping Solution

items.description: Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) solutions facilitate the integration of disparate systems and applications by providing a communication layer that allows them to exchange information. ESBs offer a range of capabilities such as message routing, transformation, protocol conversion, and data mediation. They typically support various messaging patterns and communication protocols and provide a centralized platform for managing and monitoring message traffic.
Comprehensive integration solution that leverages robust ESB capabilities to connect and orchestrate disparate systems.
items.title: Anypoint Platform

items.description: Versatile open-source integration container combining messaging, routing, and service mediation for flexible enterprise connectivity.
items.title: Apache ServiceMix

items.description: Flexible integration platform that synchronizes data across applications, streamlines partner connectivity, and enhances data accessibility.
items.title: ArcESB

items.description: Robust integration solution that connects diverse applications and protocols, ensuring seamless data flow across the enterprise.
items.title: IBM App Connect

items.description: Comprehensive platform that accelerates application integration and simplifies connectivity across heterogeneous systems.
items.title: IBM webMethods Integration

items.description: Developer-friendly, .NET-based service bus that simplifies messaging and orchestrates service integration efficiently.
items.title: NServiceBus (⭐2.1k)

items.description: Powerful ESB solution that virtualizes and manages service interactions to reduce integration complexity.
items.title: Oracle Service Bus

items.description: Comprehensive SOA platform that orchestrates services into composite applications, driving efficient business process integration.
items.title: Oracle SOA Suite

items.description: Cloud-native integration platform that delivers distributed integration capabilities for agile, scalable connectivity.
items.title: Red Hat Fuse

items.description: Enterprise-grade integration platform implementing proven hybrid integration patterns for reliable data exchange.
items.title: TIBCO BusinessWorks

items.description: High-performance ESB engineered for extreme throughput with zero-copy proxying and non-blocking IO techniques.
items.title: UltraESB

items.description: API-centric, cloud-native integration platform offering robust, distributed capabilities for modern software architectures.
items.title: WSO2 Enterprise Integrator (⭐396)
Enterprise Service Bus

items.description: The Integration frameworks section includes software tools and libraries that help developers implement and manage integration patterns in their applications. These frameworks are based on well-established Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIPs), which provide a standard vocabulary and architecture for designing and implementing integration solutions. The frameworks in this section can help simplify the process of integrating different systems, applications, and data sources by providing pre-built connectors, message routing, and transformation capabilities.
Robust integration framework leveraging Enterprise Integration Patterns to seamlessly connect diverse systems and APIs.
items.title: Apache Camel (⭐6.1k)

items.description: Innovative programming language designed for effortless creation and integration of network services and APIs.
items.title: Ballerina (⭐3.8k)

items.description: Low-code Java messaging framework that simplifies system connectivity and data integration through configurable XML setups.
items.title: Frank!Framework (⭐154)

items.description: Extension of the Spring ecosystem that provides out-of-the-box integration capabilities using proven Enterprise Integration Patterns.
items.title: Spring Integration (⭐1.6k)
Integration Frameworks

items.description: Message brokers are a type of middleware that allows communication between different applications or systems by facilitating the exchange of messages. They can handle different messaging patterns, such as point-to-point, publish-subscribe, and request-reply, and provide features such as message transformation, routing, and filtering.
Open-source broker that implements JMS, enabling seamless conversion between synchronous and asynchronous messaging.
items.title: Apache ActiveMQ (⭐2.4k)

items.description: A multi-protocol message broker, supporting various industry standard protocols such as AMQP 1.0, MQTT 3.1.1, MQTT 5, and STOMP.
items.title: Apache Artemis (⭐1k)

items.description: Distributed, high-throughput system designed for real-time data streaming and fault-tolerant processing.
items.title: Apache Kafka (⭐31k)

items.description: Versatile pub/sub and streaming platform offering scalable, low-latency messaging for modern applications.
items.title: Apache Pulsar (⭐15k)

items.description: High-performance distributed messaging platform engineered for low latency and high throughput.

items.description: AMQP-compliant messaging tool with multi-language support for enterprise-grade message delivery.

items.description: Distributed message queuing system focused on efficiency and reliability for modern workflow needs.

items.description: Scalable real-time messaging server that minimizes delay in delivering events to online users.

items.description: Realtime distributed messaging platform designed to operate at scale, handling billions of messages per day with decentralized topology.

items.description: Integrated messaging solution within Oracle databases, offering reliable and efficient message delivery.

items.description: Popular open-source broker implementing AMQP, known for reliability, clustering, and ease-of-use.

items.description: Kafka-compatible streaming platform that eliminates Zookeeper, delivering high performance and low latency.
items.title: Redpanda (⭐11k)

items.description: Redis-backed message queue written in Go, providing flexible queue management, batch consumers, and efficient delivery patterns.
items.title: RMQ (⭐1.6k)

items.description: Enterprise messaging platform based on open-source technologies, offering scalable and reliable message delivery.
items.title: Red Hat AMQ

items.description: Standards-based JMS implementation that enables efficient and robust exchange of messages between applications.
items.title: TIBCO Enterprise Message Service

items.description: Distributed, event-driven infrastructure for messaging supporting multiple protocols (HTTP, MQTT, WebSocket, CoAP) with strong security and IoT capabilities.
items.title: SuperMQ (⭐2.5k)

items.description: High-performance distributed MQTT broker designed for scalable and efficient message delivery in modern environments.
items.title: VerneMQ (⭐3.5k)
Message Broker

items.description: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) solutions are software tools that automate repetitive, rule-based tasks within business processes. RPA bots can perform tasks such as data entry, data extraction, and data processing with accuracy and speed, freeing up human workers to focus on more complex tasks.
Intelligent automation ecosystem that streamlines business processes and reduces errors through advanced RPA capabilities.
items.title: Automation Anywhere

items.description: No-code platform delivering robust, scalable automation to minimize manual tasks and boost productivity.
items.title: Blue Prism

items.description: Enterprise-grade, open-source robotic process automation suite.
items.title: OpenRPA (⭐2.8k)

items.description: An open-source automation framework with human-friendly keyword syntax that enables both technical and non-technical users to create test scripts and automate business processes cost-effectively, supporting web, API, mobile, and database automation through extensive libraries and integrations.
items.title: Robot Framework (⭐11k)

items.description: An open-source RPA tool that democratizes automation through natural language scripting in 20+ human languages, enabling non-programmers to automate web, desktop, and data tasks while integrating AI/ML capabilities via Python and R for intelligent process automation.
items.title: TagUI (⭐6.2k)

items.description: AI-powered, no-code automation solution that enhances accuracy, efficiency, and compliance across workflows.
items.title: Tungsten RPA

items.description: Comprehensive RPA platform that automates routine tasks, enabling scalable digital transformation across enterprises.
items.title: UiPath

items.description: Enterprise automation solution that combines RPA with intelligent automation to streamline complex workflows.
items.title: WorkFusion
Robotic Process Automation

items.description: Software tools that enable the design, execution, and monitoring of complex workflows or business processes. Workflow engines provide a way to automate and streamline business processes, while orchestration engines help to manage the interactions between different systems or services.
Lightweight, Java-centric BPMN engine that efficiently executes business workflows with a focus on simplicity.
items.title: Activiti (⭐10k)

items.description: Platform for programmatically creating, scheduling, and monitoring workflows, ideal for managing complex data pipelines.
items.title: Apache Airflow (⭐44k)

items.description: Container-native workflow engine designed for orchestrating parallel jobs in Kubernetes-based, cloud-native environments.
items.title: Argo Workflows (⭐16k)

items.description: Distributed scheduler that simplifies managing job dependencies in large-scale data processing environments.
items.title: Azkaban (⭐4.5k)

items.description: Open-source BPMN engine with a designer interface to build and automate complex business processes.
items.title: Bonita (⭐172)

items.description: Fault-tolerant, stateful platform that reliably orchestrates long-running workflows and complex applications.
items.title: Cadence (⭐9.1k)

items.description: Flexible workflow and decision automation platform designed for scalable business process management.
items.title: Camunda (⭐4.2k)

items.description: Cloud-based orchestration engine that manages microservices workflows, streamlining complex process automation.
items.title: Conductor (⭐12k)

items.description: NET Core library that integrates seamlessly into any application to execute and manage workflows.
items.title: Elsa Core (⭐7.6k)

items.description: Compact, efficient set of open-source engines for automating and scaling enterprise workflows.
items.title: Flowable (⭐9k)

items.description: Comprehensive toolkit for automating business processes and decisions with robust workflow management capabilities.
items.title: jBPM (⭐1.7k)

items.description: Modern, developer-friendly orchestration tool optimized for data pipelines and complex workflows.
items.title: Prefect (⭐21k)

items.description: Robust automation engine that combines sensors, triggers, and workflows to orchestrate complex IT processes.
items.title: StackStorm (⭐6.4k)

items.description: Open-source workflow-as-code platform designed for building reliable, scalable, and fault-tolerant applications.
items.title: Temporal (⭐18k)
Workflow Engine

items.description: Integration patterns provide standardized solutions for common integration problems within an enterprise. Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP) provide a common language for describing integration problems and solutions, while Integration Architecture Patterns address high-level concerns of enterprise architects. Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) patterns provide guidance for designing and implementing service-oriented architectures, ensuring that services are scalable, reusable, and loosely coupled.
items.title: Integration Patterns

items.description: Design patterns used to connect systems and applications in an efficient and seamless manner.
Use APIs to connect different systems and applications.
items.title: API-led Connectivity pattern

items.description: Add a layer to isolate and transform data between systems.
items.title: Anti Corruption Layer Pattern

items.description: Capture and propagate changes made to a database or data source in real-time.
items.title: Change Data Capture Pattern

items.description: Manage APIs that span both cloud and on-premises environments using a central control plane.
items.title: Hybrid API Management pattern

items.description: Integrate systems and applications that are deployed both on-premises and in the cloud using a combination of integration technologies.
items.title: Hybrid Integration pattern
Integration Architecture Patterns

items.description: Some useful specifications, standards, articles and documentation.
items.title: Resources

items.description: A powerful high-level language for designing and documenting APIs that allows software engineers to easily collaborate and create efficient APIs.
items.title: API Blueprint (⭐8.6k)

items.description: An essential tool for developing Event-Driven Architectures (EDA) and enables engineers to build a better tooling ecosystem.
items.title: AsyncAPI (⭐5k)

items.description: A specification for describing event data in common formats to provide interoperability across services, platforms and systems.
items.title: CloudEvents (⭐5.6k)

items.description: A sophisticated query language and runtime for building efficient APIs that empowers engineers to retrieve data from existing systems with ease.
items.title: GraphQL (⭐14k)

items.description: A standardized specification for building APIs that simplifies the representation of resources, relationships, and metadata, making it easier for software engineers to create efficient APIs.
items.title: JSON:API (⭐7.6k)

items.description: A language-agnostic specification for creating RESTful APIs that enables both humans and machines to understand the capabilities of a service without the need for source code or documentation.
items.title: OpenAPI (ex.Swagger) (⭐30k)

items.description: A RESTful API Modeling Language that allows software engineers to design and create efficient APIs by modeling resources, endpoints, and interactions.
items.title: RAML (⭐3.8k)

items.description: Open source tools and guidelines for sending webhooks easily, securely, and reliably.
items.title: Standard Webhooks (⭐1.6k)

items.description: A powerful XML-based interface description language for SOAP-based services that enables software engineers to describe the functionality of a web service and automate the creation of client code.
items.title: WSDL

items.description: Data serialization system that provides compact, fast, and efficient serialization of structured data. It supports schema evolution, allows for efficient data compression, and is designed to work well with big data processing frameworks.
items.title: Apache Avro (⭐3.2k)

items.description: Binary-encoded serialization format for JSON-like documents that is designed to be lightweight and efficient. It supports rich data types and is widely used in NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB.
items.title: BSON

items.description: A simple and widely used data format that stores tabular data in plain text. It is easy to read and write, and can be processed by most programming languages.
items.title: CSV

children.description: A standard for delimiting JSON objects in stream protocols. It allows for efficient processing of large JSON datasets and is widely used in big data processing.
children.title: NDJSON (⭐803)

children.description: A text format for storing structured data one record per line.
children.title: JSON Lines

children.description: Defined in RFC 7464, describe a specific format for transmitting or storing a sequence of individual JSON texts.
children.title: JSON Text Sequence

items.description: A lightweight and easy-to-read data format that is widely used for data exchange. It supports a wide range of data types and is compatible with many programming languages.
items.title: JSON

items.description: A language-neutral and platform-neutral serialization mechanism that is designed to be highly efficient and extensible. It supports rich data types and is widely used in distributed systems, such as gRPC and Apache Kafka.
items.title: Protocol Buffers (⭐70k)

items.description: A flexible and widely used markup language that is used for storing and exchanging structured data. It supports rich data types and is compatible with many programming languages.
items.title: XML

items.description: A human-friendly and easy-to-read data serialization format that is widely used for configuration files and data exchange. It supports rich data types and is compatible with most programming languages.
items.title: YAML (⭐453)

items.description: Your contributions are always welcome! Please take a look at the contribution guidelines first.
items.title: Contributing
